You know what's funny? Everyone always says I'm too negative, right? Like, "Oh there you go again, always looking for problems." Well, [relieved] guess who just stopped Dad from wiring twenty thousand dollars to some fake investment guru. [laugh] Yeah, that's right—me and my annoying need to, you know, actually verify things. 

[sarcastic] "But honey, he seemed so trustworthy on the video call!" Sure Mom, because scammers never seem trustworthy. I mean, [frustrated] this is exactly why I ask questions! But no, usually it's all eye rolls and "why can't you just trust people?" 

The thing is, um, when I started googling this guy's company—[excited] literally nothing came up except his own website! Created two weeks ago! And then, er, Dad's sitting there with his bank app open, [anxious] about to hit send on our entire emergency fund because this guy promised forty percent returns in three months. 

[bitter] Nobody ever appreciates the skeptic until the skeptic saves the day, honestly. But like, [warm] seeing Dad's face when he realized... when it actually clicked what almost happened? [pause] I'd rather be the annoying one who asks too many questions than, well, the family who loses everything because nobody wanted to seem rude. [sigh] Anyway, they're making my favorite dinner tonight, so I guess being paranoid has its perks.
